intro: Dryandra squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrosa dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its distinctive, often spiny foliage. The plant produces small, pink to white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. It is well adapted to the arid and nutrient-poor soils of its native habitat. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
